title: Cryogenium – an Automated Blot-Free Cryo-Plunger with Optical Realtime Feedback for Single-Particle and Cell-Based Workflows
content: Understanding the structure and mechanisms of proteins and enzymes, also in their cellular context, is key for studying disease mechanisms at molecular level and designing drugs. The 2017 Chemistry Nobel Prize for cryo-Electron Microscopy honoured this “technique to image bio-molecules”. Applications of the technique have grown rapidly. However, the sample preparation is still a critical and often difficult element in the overall workflow. Several groups worldwide are working to solve this challenge.
